item.title: Week 11 - Correlation (Part 2)
item.description: Handouts Functions Lab LaTeX Weekly Prep Lecture Slides Creating Correlation Tables As we discuss this week, R’s correlation output leaves much to be desired relative to statistical software applications like Stata or SAS. I’ve written a function (based on a few others that are floating around) that adds a bit of flexibility and precision to the correlation calculation process, and returns output with correlation coefficients and statistical significance values combined.
